result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

11:37 AM Defendant Tristan D. Plautz in court.  Attorney James Charles Koppelman Mr. in court for Tristan D. Plautz.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to the charge/charges.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall have no contact with A.A.P. - dob:  4-26-1994.   Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

01:01 PM Attorney James Charles Koppelman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   The state requested signature bond in the amount of $3,000.00  booking; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license; no contact with A.A.P. - dob:  4-26-1994.  Court sets bond as requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm. - rt

11:30 am   Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tristan D. Plautz appeared in person, in custody.  Probable cause was previously found.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $2,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license; no contact with A.A.P. - dob:  4-26-1994.
